column1: Halbarad was a Rangers of the North of Eriador.
Halbarad spent his early life watching the borders of the Shire.
During the War of the Ring
column2: Halbarad was sent to the aid of his Chieftains of the Dúnedain Aragorn. From Eriador
column3: he led a thirty-man strong group of Rangers
column4: calling themselves the Grey Company. With them rode Elladan and Elrohir
column5: the sons of Elrond. In the night between the 5 March and the 6 March
column6: the Company met Aragorn at Dol Baran. Halbarad gave his kinsman a standard
column7: which was a gift from Arwen
column9: summoning him to take the Paths of the Dead.

column2: now with Gimli and Legolas part of Aragorns comitatus
column3: passed through the Paths of the Dead
column6: and on to Pelargir. He captained a Corsair ship and they sailed toward Harlond in Gondor.

column1: On 15 March they arrived on the Pelennor Fields and fought in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields. Halbarad unfurled the standard
column2: and it showed the White Tree of Gondor of Gondor and the signs of Elendil. He was killed in this battle
column3: and would never return to the North.

column1: 1979: The Lord of the Rings (1979 radio series):
:Halbarad is played by an uncredited actor.
1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:Halbarad had a role similar to his role in the book. He was voiced by Martyn Read.

column2: a hidden Dúnedain city in the North Downs. After receiving orders from Elrond to seek out Aragorn in Rohan
column3: Halbarad gathered a large company of Rangers to head south. After suffering short delays in Enedwaith
column4: Halbarad managed to form an alliance of sorts with the Falcon Clan in Dunland. However
column5: Halbarad and his company were soon betrayed and imprisoned by the Falcon Clan. Some of the Rangers with Halbarad managed to escape and soon the Grey Company was free
column6: at the cost of many lives. By the time they reached the borders of Rohan

column1: 2011: The Lord of the Rings: War in the North:
